name: reoccupation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a situation in which an army or group of people moves into and takes control of a place again: A spokesperson said that there were no plans for a reoccupation of the land. They built new defences to prevent re-occupation by the invaders.
[ U ] the act of using or living in a building again: The office will be be ready for reoccupation next week. They are planning the reoccupation of an abandoned fort. Related words
occupation
reoccupy
More examplesFewer examplesPlans for the reoccupation of the peninsula are now well advanced.The authorities approved the re-occupation of the island by its original inhabitants.Police officers tried to prevent a reoccupation of the building by the protesters.
